question: The "El Cajas National Park" is located in which country?
explanation: El Cajas National Park, also known as Cajas National Park, is an IUCN Category II national park located in highlands of Ecuador. It hosts tundra vegetation on a judged landscape of hills and valleys. It is a Ramsar Wetland. Tomebamba and Yanuncay Rivers originates from this national park. It is also an Important Bird Area. It is a home to a large variety of animals, some of which are endemic or highly endangered.
